Title: Girl, Goddess, Queen
Author: Bea Fitzgerald
My Review:
3.5 — Cute but mundane. Not too much detail. I don’t even know what the characters actually looked like. Nothing was ever really explored in full. Quick read but found myself getting bored at the end. Oh well! I like Persephone though she’s cool. Hades was also such a little baby boy so sweet and delicate. Definitely a unique Greek Mythology retelling I haven’t really seen anything like it.

I’m also realizing that the FAF series is just Hades and Persephone in a different font. A wayyyyy better font if you ask me though.

I actually only bought this book because it was next to the only outlet in Waterstones and I felt awk about standing there charging my phone so I started to fake read this book.

TTPD — But Daddy I Love Him

Title: Queen of Shadows (Throne of Glass #4)
Author: Sarah J. Maas
My Review:
6/5 stars — Impeccable. I understand why we needed to world build so hard because it made the worlds colliding 100000s times more impactful. The ups and downs then ups again of the relationships in this book were what made it one of the best books I’ve ever read. Truly the love and devotion each character comes to develop for one another is unlike anything else. So realistic and inspiring it makes me reflect and appreciate my own friendships. Makes you realize that the world could go to utter shit but if you have the right people by you then nothing even matters and you can get through the hard shit!!

That takeaway right there is why books rock!!!!!!

There were some lines that hit so hard I had to take a moment to recover. I wish I highlighted them but guess it gives me a reason to reread in the future

Author: Sarah J. Maas
My Review:
4.25/5 — My brain doesn’t know what to think. I am mixed about the different POVs because even though some were boring I know they will eventually be relevant. I really only cared about Rowan and Celaena.

Like a lot happened but did the plot really move forward?

Also can we give Dorian a fucking break? Holy shit the guy just keeps taking Ls

I need someone to please send me a Ashryver Galathynius family tree because I am so confused who is related to who and who has what powers and who ruled what land.

~Aelin~ really said there will be no further explanation. There will just be Reputation.

Title: The Assassin's Blade (Throne of Glass, #0.1-0.5)
Author: Sarah J. Maas
My Review: 4 stars —

Title: Crown of Midnight (Throne of Glass #2)
Author: Sarah J. Maas
My Review:
4.25 — WOOAAHHHHHHHHHHH

I missed SJM and having shit hit the absolute fan in the last 25 percent of the book.

A lot happened. I cried. I laughed. I scared.

I am really scared for what is to come considering it conjured so many emotions for me but wasn’t even the best book I have ever read. What is going to be left of me 5 books from now???

I really feel like that blonde woman doing math meme rn and have a feeling I will remain that way for the foreseeable future.

I knew REDACTED and REDACTED were one and the same but idk why it didn’t really hit until the truth was revealed.

The world continues to build….until then the books will probably remain less than 5 stars but I know big things await.

However I’m going to dedicated the entire album of Midnights to this book to no surprise at all.

Honorable mentions:
miss Americana and the heartbreak Prince
haunted
illicit affairs
daylight
right where you left me
peace

Title: A Fire in the Flesh (Flesh and Fire, #3)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review:
4.5 — I had a serious manic episode reading this book (like less than 2 days to finish this 700 page book type manic). My eyes were moving and I was reading but I feel like I retained nothing because I was trying to read it so fast.

KOLIS IS A MAYOR OF PERV CITY PUT HIM ON THE LIST RN!!! hide your kids hide your wife legitimately they would be in danger.


The end was not what I wanted and it got reallly freaky real fast. Also can they just accept compliments?? They spend a majority of the book trying to out compliment each other.

I felt similar about this book as I did Iron Flame as it was great but had a feeling early on that it wouldn’t be a 5 star great if that makes sense.

AUGUST 13. I will be out of commission emotionally and physically. The ending of this series won’t be pretty and I apologize in advance.

I’m calling it now that Poppy is Sotoria 100 percent.

Also give us more Reaver content?? He’s important in FBAA but not even talked about in this book

Ash and Cassian fighting for number on book bf at the moment.

TTPD — Fresh Out The Slammer!!! x imgonnagetyouback

Title: A Soul of Ash and Blood (Blood and Ash, #5)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review:
3.0 — hey guys so what the fuck was that? That ending? For the love of god enough with the random ass subplots it’s killing me.

He turned into what? Major ick and beyond dumb

This book was fine. Definitely not necessary in the slightest for the overall series but it was kinda nice to go down memory lane of the first time reading FBAA.

Casteel please get up your being too much of a simp.

How many more books in this series? Genuinely seems like no one will ever find peace.

TTPD — I Hate It Here/I Look in Peoples Windows

Title: A Light in the Flame (Flesh and Fire, #2)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review: 5 stars — Spectacular give me 14 of em right now. Haven’t been this obsessed with a series and/or fantasy relationship since ACOTAR. These past two books of FAF are without a doubt in my top 5 books of all time. Is the writing cringey and grammatically incorrect at times? Yes but I’m too stupid to care. I’m LOCKED

Title: The War of Two Queens (Blood and Ash, #4)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review:
4.25 stars — As a result of reading A Shadow in the Ember, I feel like I was the Leonardo DiCaprio pointing meme for the entirety of this book lol.

This book literally had minor incest, butt stuff, and a threesome or die situation yet I still gave it a solid rating despite the amount of cringing I did. The anticipation and lore was just that good.

If this series didn’t have its prequel series I would’ve given the book a 3 but the extra information was much appreciated and felt like I was in on a little secret the whole time. Don’t get me wrong, I am still extremely confused but I’ve learned that this is part of the JLA writing experience.

Also, Reaver I love you so much it hurts my soul!!!!!

Millicent seems like my kind of girl and would love to yap with her if given the chance.

Cas and Poppy are starting to give Rhys and Feyre in ACOFAS and it’s quite unfortunate.

BACK TO SERA AND NYKTOS YALLLLLLLLL


TTPD — imgonnagetyouback; Who’s Afraid of Little Old Me?

Title: The Women
Author: Kristin Hannah
My Review:
4.5– Find me at the Vietnam Women’s Memorial first thing tomorrow morning.

Crying my eyes out. I truly haven’t thought of the Vietnam War since APUSH but this book really did a number on me.

I’m not used to reading shit this real. Kind of jarring in a good way.

I feel as though it would be disrespectful to equate a Taylor Swift breakup album with the women who served in Vietnam so Woman by Kesha will have to do. Lol

Title: Born of Blood and Ash (Flesh and Fire, #4)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout

Title: The Penelopiad
Author: Margaret Atwood
My Review:
4.75 — Penelope and me fr the same. Mystery is our greatest weapon. Self awareness off the charts! Play the part but always be one step ahead.

Really enjoyed this modern take on Penelope’s POV from the underworld. It was Penelope giving a retelling of her life (from the dead) in the context of 2024. Nothing I hadn’t heard before about Penelope but so uniquely portrayed. Made me chuckle and very clever. Margaret Atwood a living genius

Title: A Shadow in the Ember (Flesh and Fire, #1)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review:
1 million stars/5 — speechless. uno mf reverse.

A Shadow in the Ember just blew its counterpart (FBAA) out of the damn water.

It was perfect. Plot was perfect. Character development was perfect. Relationship was perfect. Ending was…….you guessed it…..perfect.

Cas and Poppy who??

Could not put it down for a second. When I wasn’t actually reading it, I was counting down the minutes until i could get my paws on my kindle. It was a bees to honey type a situation. Book was hitting so hard that I even got the physical copy from the library to switch up my modes of reading.

Are my feelings about this book a little overinflated because it’s 2:30 am and I just finished it? Potentially.

Am I psychotic? Most definitely.

TTPD — The Alchemy; But Daddy I Love Him;
but honestly it’s just giving folklore/evermore to its core

Title: The Song of Achilles
Author: Madeline Miller
My Review:
4.75/5 stars — Song of Achillies changed my brain chemistry. I am about to enter my Greek mythology era (aka another intense month long fixation that everyone will be subjugated to hear about).

The love Achillies and Patroclus had for each other was so soft and unwavering. Who knew that when the most introverted introvert meets and falls in love with the greatest extrovert known to man, that it would shape the course of an entire war? An unfortunate love story and rise and fall of two amazing characters.

The ending ripped my heart from my chest, threw it against a wall, apologized, then put it back gently….never to ever be the same again though.

“What has Hector ever done to me?” *gets to the end of the book and my knees hit the floor so hard it causes a seismic tremor*


TTDP Association - loml; The Propechy (literally); I Can Fix Him (No Really I Can)
Midnights special edition - The Great War (duh)

Title: Atalanta
Author: Jennifer Saint
My Review:
2.5 — is it fair to give a greek mythology retelling a low rating even though the author didn’t come up with the actual story?

I found myself wanting to get through this book so I could just see how it ends and move on. It wasn’t that exciting and I was a bit conflicted with the anti-man/strong female/feminist lead/defying gender roles story line just for her to find happiness once she got married? Like girl can have it both but don’t just abruptly have her fall in love and get married and call it a happily ever after considering everything leading up to that shows the exact opposite (once being turned into lions may I mention) ?? Very conflicted with this story if y’all couldn’t tell. Missed the target big time in my opinion unfortunately.

It’s going to be a 2 star rating from me which is rare.

TTPD Association — Fresh Out The Slammer

This book is the epitome of “Is somebody gonna match my freak?”

Title: Circe
Author: Madeline Miller
My Review:
3.75 — The ending was one of the best book endings I’ve ever read. If you get past the weird Greek god incest and glorification of human death then you could consider it a happily ever after.

My girl Circe was such a complex character. She was just like me at times fr. I felt angry at her and angry for her at one point or another for the entirety of the book. I give it a 3.75 because it wasn’t anything special but still very much worth the read. It didn’t have me emotionally distraught but it definitely was an alluring story.

It scratched my green mythology itch! I will be reading about Penelope and/or Ariadne next considering their cameos in this book. Lowkey also learned quite a different side of Odysseus which left a bad taste in my mouth.

TTPD Association -- The Prophecy (truly the epitome of this book)

Title: Ugly Love
Author: Colleen Hoover
My Review:
3.5 - it was good, then meh, then I was ugly crying (no pun intended) then I was so excited because I thought it wasn’t going to end cheesy. Then I spoke too soon and it ended in the most clique, cheeseball way ever. I shouldn’t even be surprise bc I know what the ending is going to be like in every coho book and each time I want to gag at the main characters happiness. So it ultimately sounds like a me problem.

This is so ducked up to say because she went through a lot but I’m so mad at Rachel for letting our baby Miles suffer for as long as he did. HE WAS HURTING TOO!!!!!

Miles has to be one of mine, if not my favorite coho character.

Two quotes from the queen herself to put this book into perspective….

You don’t get to tell me about sad.
I love you it’s ruining my life.


However, it’s meant in a I want to love you but I can’t not in an I love you and you suck the life out of me way that TS meant it.

Title: A Kingdom of Flesh and Fire (Blood and Ash, #2)
Author: Jennifer L. Armentrout
My Review:
Lowkey 4 stars because I think it was too long but the slow burn and ~attempted~ denial of love was *chefs kiss* I think there were too many random things that would get mentioned and didn’t really add to the story or were quickly forgotten about. Also there should be an appendix with all the different variations of these vampires and wolves and humans because Im finding it hard to keep up. The ending was too much of a confusing cliff hanger for me but I did really love the characters and the rapport between characters. I will be reading the third obviously as I need to know what the hell all of that meant and what the hell Poppy is exactly in relation to the gods? Also Alistar is a sus mf and not the be trusted.

Also I think I understand JLA and the way she writes her books because she’s really not completing any story line and thus making readers continue to read and buy this series (Hence why it’s like 6+ books at this point)

Title: Reminders of Him

SPOILERS AHEAD (like anyone that follows me will actually read this lmao)

Title: Throne of Glass (Throne of Glass, #1)
Author: Sarah J. Maas
My Review: 4.5 stars. It didn’t have me at the edge of my seat/emotionally distraught which is part of my criteria for a 5 start book. The characters were lovable and the banter was impeccable. You can tell SJM is setting the stage for the whole series with this book and getting us warmed up for what is to come. I would say this book boarders YA genre but it was simple and enjoyable nonetheless. You will never see me bashing a book with a badass female lead.

Title: Iron Flame (The Empyrean, #2)
Author: Rebecca Yarros
My Review: I had to take a minute before I felt like I could impassively review this book. I knew almost 50% of the way through that this would be a 4(.5) star book. Though it was engaging, I didn’t feel as passionate about getting through it as I did Fourth Wing. IMO there were too many subplots going on and though the author did a great job tying them in throughout the end of the book, it was just all a bit much to keep up with. Some of these subplots were also a bit anticlimactic. With that being said, I do think these books are extremely detailed and well thought out. I really have come to love the characters and the relationship development over the course of the story. Per usual, the last few pages left me absolutely gagged for about 5 minutes after closing the book. The author has managed the art of cliff hangers that is for sure. I will be pre ordering Onyx Storm

Title: In Five Years

Moral of the story…TELL PEOPLE YOU LOVE THEM AND LIVE IN THE PRESENT!!!

Going to need a lighter read after this one…

The friendships and overall relationship developments throughout the book were my favorite part. Think I might go and watch the movie again for fun!
